definition:
[**Definition**]{} Suppose $M$ is a smooth manifold, and $X$ is a smooth
vector field on $M$. Then an [**integral curve**]{} of $X$ through a
point $x\in M$ is a curve $c\colon I\to M$, such that $$\begin{aligned}
 c'(t) &=& (X\circ c)(t), \,\,\,\,\,\,\,\mbox{for all $t$ in $I$}\\
 c(0) &=& x.\end{aligned}$$ Here $I\subset {\mathbb{R}}$ is some open
interval of $0$, and $c'(t)$ is the tangent vector in $T_{c(t)}M$
represented by the curve.

Suppose $x^i$ are local coordinates for $M$, $c^i$ are functions
representing $c$ in these local coordinates, and
$X=X^i \frac{\partial}{\partial x^i}$. Then the condition on $c$ is
$$\frac{dc^i}{dt}(t) = X^i\circ c(t), \quad \mbox{for all $t$}.$$
